content.text: Git Best Practices
Summary of Git Best Practices
Commit Often
Make small, frequent commits to capture your progress.
content.html: Make small, frequent commits to capture your progress.

content.text: This makes it easier to track changes and find bugs.
content.html: This makes it easier to track changes and find bugs.

content.code:
git

add

.


git
commit -m
"Add user authentication logic"
content.code_html:
git add .
git commit -m "Add user authentication logic"

content.text: Write Clear Commit Messages
Use descriptive messages that explain why a change was made, not just what changed.
content.html: Use descriptive messages that explain why a change was made, not just what changed.

content.text: Good commit messages help you and your team understand the history of the project.
content.html: Good commit messages help you and your team understand the history of the project.

content.code:
git
commit -m
"Fix bug in user login validation"
content.code_html: git commit -m "Fix bug in user login validation"

content.text: Use Branches
Create branches for features, fixes, and experiments to keep your main branch stable.
content.html: Create branches for features, fixes, and experiments to keep your main branch stable.

content.text: This way, you can work on new ideas without affecting the main codebase.
content.html: This way, you can work on new ideas without affecting the main codebase.

content.code_html: git checkout -b feature/login-form

content.text: Pull Before You Push
Always git pull before pushing.
content.html: Always git pull before pushing.

content.text: This updates your local branch with changes from others, helps you avoid conflicts, and ensures your push will succeed.
content.html: This updates your local branch with changes from others, helps you avoid conflicts, and ensures your push will succeed.

content.text: Why? If someone else has pushed changes since your last pull, your push may be rejected or cause conflicts.
content.html: Why? If someone else has pushed changes since your last pull, your push may be rejected or cause conflicts.

content.text: Pulling first lets you fix any issues locally.
content.html: Pulling first lets you fix any issues locally.

content.code:
git
pull origin main

git
push origin main
content.code_html:
git pull origin main
git push origin main

content.text: Review Changes Before Committing
Use git status and git diff to review your changes before you commit.
content.html: Use git status and git diff to review your changes before you commit.

content.text: This helps you catch mistakes early.
content.html: This helps you catch mistakes early.

content.code_html:
git status
git diff

content.text: Keep Repositories Small
Avoid adding large files or unnecessary dependencies.
content.html: Avoid adding large files or unnecessary dependencies.

content.text: This keeps your repository fast and easy to clone.
content.html: This keeps your repository fast and easy to clone.

content.text: Use .gitignore
Exclude files that shouldn't be tracked (like build artifacts, log files, or secrets) by adding them to a .gitignore file.
content.html: Exclude files that shouldn't be tracked (like build artifacts, log files, or secrets) by adding them to a .gitignore file.

content.text: Note: .gitignore only prevents new files from being tracked.
content.html: Note: .gitignore only prevents new files from being tracked.

content.text: Files already tracked by Git will remain in the repository until you remove them with git rm --cached < file > .
content.html: Files already tracked by Git will remain in the repository until you remove them with git rm --cached <file>.

content.code_html:
# .gitignore
node_modules/
*.log
.env

content.text: Tag Releases
Use tags to mark release points (like v1.0 ) so you can easily find and reference important versions.
content.html: Use tags to mark release points (like v1.0) so you can easily find and reference important versions.

content.text: This helps you keep track of your project's history and make it easier to roll back to previous versions if needed.
content.html: This helps you keep track of your project's history and make it easier to roll back to previous versions if needed.

content.code:
git
tag v1.0

git
push origin v1.0
content.code_html:
git tag v1.0
git push origin v1.0

content.text: Note: Good Git habits make it easier for your team (and your future self) to understand and build on your work.
content.html: Note: Good Git habits make it easier for your team (and your future self) to understand and build on your work.
